parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From a presumed derivative of memphomai and moira; blaming fate, i.e. Querulous.
A murmurer, grumbler. From gogguzo; a grumbler.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural

str2: A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Immoderate, boastful, excessive, pompous. From huper and ogkos; bulging over, i.e. insolent.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire. From thauma; to wonder; by implication, to admire.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
Accusative case of charis as preposition; through favor of, i.e. On account of.
Usefulness, profit, advantage, benefit, gain. From a derivative of the base of ophelimos; usefulness, i.e. Benefit.
